dict.string:
Dear _____, 


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


Please note that there is a message sending rate for Twilio long codes. The message sending rate is 1 SMS message per second per long code and no more than 200 messages per day. (volume applies more specifically for +1 US/Canada regions) 


For more information, please see: https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/115002943027-Understanding-Twilio-Rate-Limits-and-Message-Queues  


Once you reach the sending limit threshold, your messages will be put in queue. Twilio will go in the order of 1 message per second to clear out the queue. However, this can slow down in sending messages out and messages can be delayed if you are sending many messages all at once. If the queue is too big and many messages are over the threshold, messages will fail and will not be sent out after 4 hours.


If you are attempting to send a heavy volume of SMS messages, I will advise to rotate among more than 1 Twilio number, consider using a short code, or consider using our Copilot feature that will scale and distribute your traffic evenly among your numbers. Please be aware that heavy volume may also be potentially filtered by carriers. Below I have also attached information about how to avoid carrier filtering and using Copilot: 


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223181848-How-Does-Carrier-Filtering-Work-  


https://www.twilio.com/docs/glossary/what-is-a-short-code


https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/sending-messages-copilot#scaler 


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help. 


Warmest Regards,
Queue Insights - Messaging Sending Rate Limitations

Dear _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!
Please note that there is a message sending rate for Twilio long codes. The message sending rate is 1 SMS message per second per long code and no more than 200 messages per day. (volume applies more specifically for +1 US/Canada regions)
For more information, please see: https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/115002943027-Understanding-Twilio-Rate-Limits-and-Message-Queues
Once you reach the sending limit threshold, your messages will be put in queue. Twilio will go in the order of 1 message per second to clear out the queue. However, this can slow down in sending messages out and messages can be delayed if you are sending many messages all at once. If the queue is too big and many messages are over the threshold, messages will fail and will not be sent out after 4 hours.
If you are attempting to send a heavy volume of SMS messages, I will advise to rotate among more than 1 Twilio number, consider using a short code, or consider using our Copilot feature that will scale and distribute your traffic evenly among your numbers. Please be aware that heavy volume may also be potentially filtered by carriers. Below I have also attached information about how to avoid carrier filtering and using Copilot:
https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223181848-How-Does-Carrier-Filtering-Work-
https://www.twilio.com/docs/glossary/what-is-a-short-code
https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/sending-messages-copilot#scaler
Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,

Dear _____, 


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear you are unable to deliver your messages.


I took a look at your SMS logs and it appears that you are sending a large amount of messages and they are currently in "queued" state. 


Please note that there is a message sending rate for Twilio long codes. The message sending rate is 1 SMS message per second. 


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/115002943027-Understanding-Twilio-Rate-Limits-and-Message-Queues


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223183648-Sending-and-Receiving-Limitations-on-Calls-and-SMS-Messages


Once you reach the sending limit threshold, your messages will be put in queue. Twilio will go in the order of 1 message per second to clear out the queue. However, this can slow down in sending messages out and messages can be delayed if you are sending many messages at one time. If the queue is too big and many messages are over the threshold, messages will fail and will not be sent out after 4 hours.


If you are attempting to send a heavy volume of SMS messages, I will advise to rotating among more than 1 Twilio number, consider using a short code, or consider using our Copilot service that will be able to distribute your traffic evenly among your Twilio numbers. 


https://www.twilio.com/docs/glossary/what-is-a-short-code


https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/sending-messages-copilot#scaler 


Please also be aware of Carrier Filtering when messages are being sent in high volumes: https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223181848-How-Does-Carrier-Filtering-Work-  


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help. 


Warmest Regards,
Queue Insights - Messaging Sending Limitations - High Queue not Delivered

Dear _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear you are unable to deliver your messages.
I took a look at your SMS logs and it appears that you are sending a large amount of messages and they are currently in "queued" state.
Please note that there is a message sending rate for Twilio long codes. The message sending rate is 1 SMS message per second.
https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/115002943027-Understanding-Twilio-Rate-Limits-and-Message-Queues
https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223183648-Sending-and-Receiving-Limitations-on-Calls-and-SMS-Messages
Once you reach the sending limit threshold, your messages will be put in queue. Twilio will go in the order of 1 message per second to clear out the queue. However, this can slow down in sending messages out and messages can be delayed if you are sending many messages at one time. If the queue is too big and many messages are over the threshold, messages will fail and will not be sent out after 4 hours.
If you are attempting to send a heavy volume of SMS messages, I will advise to rotating among more than 1 Twilio number, consider using a short code, or consider using our Copilot service that will be able to distribute your traffic evenly among your Twilio numbers.
https://www.twilio.com/docs/glossary/what-is-a-short-code
https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/sending-messages-copilot#scaler
Please also be aware of Carrier Filtering when messages are being sent in high volumes: https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223181848-How-Does-Carrier-Filtering-Work-
Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,

MAKE SURE MSG FEEDBACK IS ENABLED ON ACCOUNT CHECK FLAG: "Enable Feedback API"
-------


Dear _______,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support and your interest in using Twilio's Message Feedback API. 

Please note that your account _____ already has this feature enabled. To start using Message Feedback API, please review the below documentation to learn how to use this API:

https://www.twilio.com/docs/sms/api/message-feedback

Please note that by default most of Twilio's accounts have this feature enabled. If you have other additional Twilio accounts in which you will like me to check to see if this feature is enabled please provide the Account SIDs and I will be more than happy to help you check. 

I hope this information is helpful. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help. 

Warmest Regards,
Messaging Feedback: Customer Interested in Messaging Feedback API

MAKE SURE MSG FEEDBACK IS ENABLED ON ACCOUNT CHECK FLAG: "Enable Feedback API" -------
Dear _______,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support and your interest in using Twilio's Message Feedback API.
Please note that your account _____ already has this feature enabled. To start using Message Feedback API, please review the below documentation to learn how to use this API:
https://www.twilio.com/docs/sms/api/message-feedback
Please note that by default most of Twilio's accounts have this feature enabled. If you have other additional Twilio accounts in which you will like me to check to see if this feature is enabled please provide the Account SIDs and I will be more than happy to help you check.
I hope this information is helpful. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
